application.doc: Retrieve the current remote syslog forwarding policy

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve the current remote syslog forwarding policy
method.doc: The system provides the ability to forward entries from local log files to a remote syslog server. To retrieve the current remote syslog forwarding policy issue a HTTP GET request against the remote syslog forwarding resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

representation.name: rsyslogForwarderJson
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: server
param.doc: The IP address or host name of the remote syslog server.

param.name: port
param.doc: The port on which the remote syslog server is listening.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Whether the forwarder process will be started in debug mode. All trace messages will be sent to the log file of the remote syslog forwarder.

param.name: protocol
param.doc: The protocol which will be used when communicating with the remote syslog server. Valid options are: 'udp', 'tcp' or 'tls'.

param.name: format
param.doc: The format of the messages which are forwarded to the rsyslog server. Valid options are: 'rfc-3164' or 'rfc-5424'.

param.name: keyfile
param.doc: The name of the key file which contains the SSL certificates used when communicating with the remote syslog server (e.g. pdsrv). This option is required if the protocol is 'tls'.

param.name: ca_certificate
param.doc: The label which is used to identify within the SSL key file the CA certificate of the remote syslog server. This option is required if the protocol is 'tls'.

param.name: client_certificate
param.doc: The label which is used to identify within the SSL key file the client certificate which will be used during mutual authentication with the remote syslog server.

param.name: permitted_peers
param.doc: The subject DN of the remote syslog server. If this policy data is not specified any certificates which have been signed by the CA will be accepted.

param.name: sources
param.doc: The source of the log file entries which will be sent to the remote syslog server.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the log file source. The list of available source names can be retrieved via the 'source_names' Web service.

param.name: tag
param.doc: The tag to be used to designate the messages which originate from this source. This tag will be prepended to all messages that are sent to the remote syslog server.

param.name: facility
param.doc: The syslog facility which will be used when sending messages to the remote syslog server. Valid values include: kern, user, mail, daemon, auth, syslog, lpr, news, uucp, cron, security, ftp, ntp, logaudit, logalert, clock, local0, local1, local2, local3, local4, local5, local6, local7.

param.name: severity
param.doc: The syslog severity which will be used when sending messages to the remote syslog server. Valid values include: emerg, alert, crit, error, warning, notice, info, debug.
